Class RotCODEC

  • java.lang.Object
    • RotCODEC

  • public class RotCODEC
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for coding/decoding letter or number characters in ROT13 and ROT5 respectively. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ROT13.
    Version:
    13 June 2013
    Author:
    hqcasanova.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RotCODEC() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static char rotten(char iChar)
      Converts a character, be it a letter (upper or lower case) or number, to a new one according to ROT13/5.
      static java.lang.String rotten(java.lang.String sText)
      The string version of the above method: traverses the whole string to convert it character by character.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RotCODEC

        public RotCODEC()

    • Method Detail

      • rotten

        public static char rotten(char iChar)
        Converts a character, be it a letter (upper or lower case) or number, to a new one according to ROT13/5. Based on Robert Sedgewick and Kevin Wayne's code: http://introcs.cs.princeton.edu/java/31datatype/Rot13.java.html
        Parameters:
        iChar - ASCII code of character to code/decode.
        Returns:
        Converted character.

      • rotten

        public static java.lang.String rotten(java.lang.String sText)
        The string version of the above method: traverses the whole string to convert it character by character. If the string is only 1 character in length, traversing is avoided.
        Parameters:
        sText - String to encode/decode
        Returns:
        Converted string.
